abstract: Pioneering rap group De La Soul prepares to release album And the Anonymous Nobody, its first in 12 years; members have been frustrated with Warner Music Group’s unwillingness to make their early records available for download or streaming due to questionable clearance of sampled material; new album is self-produced and mostly free of samples in effort to facilitate digital distribution.

headline.print_headline: A Hip-Hop Legacy Stuck in Digital Limbo
headline.main: De La Soul’s Legacy Is Trapped in Digital Limbo

snippet: The hip-hop pioneers have their first new album in 12 years, “And the Anonymous Nobody.” But if you want to hear their early work, look for CDs, vinyl and cassettes....
lead_paragraph: The hip-hop pioneers have their first new album in 12 years, “And the Anonymous Nobody.” But if you want to hear their early work, look for CDs, vinyl and cassettes.
